alert.note: Alert for Coshocton; Guernsey; Muskingum; Tuscarawas (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pittsburgh (Western Pennsylvania and East Central Ohio)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:57PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT WESTERN GUERNSEY...SOUTHEASTERN COSHOCTON...EASTERN MUSKINGUM AND SOUTH CENTRAL TUSCARAWAS COUNTIES THROUGH 630 PM EDT... At 557 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near North Zanesville, or near Zanesville, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Zanesville, Cambridge, Newcomerstown, New Concord, South Zanesville, North Zanesville, Philo, Pleasant Grove, Plainfield, Norwich, High Hill, and Chandlersville. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Ohio between mile markers 154 and 177. Interstate 77 in Ohio between mile markers 49 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM EDT for east central Ohio.
